page.title: 14GARDENS
page.content: MOST HOUSES IN CHEDZOY HAVE LARGE GARDENS.EVERYONE HAS A LAWN,A GRASSY AREA FOR SITTING OUT IN THE SUN AND WHERE THE CHILDREN CAN PLAY NEAR THE HOUSE.MOST PEOPLE GROW FLOWERS AND VEGETABLES.THE PARISH COUNCIL AWARD A CUP FOR THE BEST KEPT GARDEN EACH YEAR THIS YEAR THERE IS TO BE AN EXTRA CUP, THE MONMOUTH CUP,FOR SMALL GARDENS,AS WE ARE CELEBRATING THE TERCENTENARY OF THE BATTLE OF SEDGEMOOR.POPULAR FLOWERS ARE DAFFODILS,TULIPS,SNOWDROPS HYACINTHS AND OTHER BULBS IN THE SPRING,AUBRETIA AND OTHER ROCKERY PLANTS,PANSIES,LOBELIA,ALYSSUM,BEGONIA STOCKS,LUPINS,PAEONIES,DELPHINIUMS,NAS TURTIUMS,MARIGOLDS FOR BEDDING AND HERBACEOUS DISPLAYS IN SUMMER,AND ROSES OF ALL VARIETIES.TWO CLIMBING PLANTS ARE THE CLEMATIS,ESPECIALLY JACKMANII,A VERY DARK BLUE,AND BLUE WISTERIA.
